Line17.8CA44: Ah! This is wonderful! Like old times, eh, Deckard?
VoiceDir19.6D03F: The last two sentences are spoken to the player
Line1.8CA44: Enh? Whassat? I'm paid up. Leave me be.
VoiceDir5.8CA44: groggy, confused. You're seeing a symbol pinned to a visitor's cloak you barely remember from your youth
VoiceDir1.8CA44: Annoyed. Groggy. Someone just woke you up from a narcotic-induced sleep
Line13.8CA44: Sandstorm, eh? The others must’ve turned you down. Told you some rubbish about a sorcerer I’ll wager! (cackles)
Line3.6D03F: We're not here to collect. We need--
Line5.8CA44: Hmm? It can’t be… can it? Is that the symbol of the Ho... Hora... uh...
Line9.8CA44: Yes! Horadrim! Deckard? Deckard Cain?! Can it be you, old friend? It’s me! Meshif!
Line11.6D03F: No, Deckard is gone. My name is Lorath. We need your help passing through the sandstorm to the north.
VoiceDir13.8CA44: extremely amused. You're the worlds funniest man
Line15.8CA44: Well, what can a sorcerer do to me that time hasn't already! (laughs) Yes, yes! I’ll help! There's an old chapel near there, an auspicious spot to begin a new adventure!
Line19.6D03F: Good. Gather whatever you need. I'll fetch Taissa and meet you there.
